sub_title: Heating and cooling at the European Commission JRC
summary:
Lorcan has extensive experience in energy and environmental policy. At the European Commission Joint Research Centre he works on heating and cooling, in particular waste heat and heat pumps. He has also published a report on digitalisation, and worked as a co-ordinator of briefings for the Director-General and Commissioner.

Prior to that, he worked as an independent consultant for the International Energy Agency, UNEP REN21 and SEforALL.

In 2014-2015, Lorcan worked for the IEA as an energy efficiency policy analyst. His main responsibility was as co-author of the Energy Efficiency Market Report series, leading chapters on energy efficiency indicators, energy efficiency finance, and country and city market profiles. Lorcan was also the project manager of the IEA Policies and Measures Databases on energy efficiency, climate change and renewables.

From 2009 to 2013, Lorcan worked for an environmental policy consultancy (Bio Intelligence Service, now part of Deloitte France). His main client was the European Commission (DG Environment and DG Energy mainly). Lorcan successfully delivered studies on a wide range of topics, including renewable energy and energy efficiency. These studies involved research, policy analysis, writing, project management and stakeholder engagement including with the European Commission, governments and industry.

Lorcan also worked at the IEA from 2004 to 2008. As a member of the World Energy Outlook team, his role encompassed data collection, analysis, drafting and editing and event organisation. Topics included household energy in developing countries, energy in China, and climate change policy. Lorcan spent his first year at the IEA as a data manager on renewables and energy price data.

Lorcan's academic background includes an MSc (Merit) from Imperial College London, where he specialised in environmental economics and policy. He also has an honours BA degree from Trinity College Dublin in economics and politics, including a year at Sciences Po Paris. Lorcan is a native English speaker with excellent French.
